did.unittitle: U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics Budget for Special Reports on Microfilm

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: United States. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS)

did.abstract: Budgets for special reports of the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) is a unit of the United States Department of Labor. It is the main fact-finding agency for the U.S. government in the field of labor economics and statistics and is the main agency of the U.S. Federal Statistical System. The BLS is a governmental statistical agency that collects, processes, analyzes, and disseminates essential statistical data to the American public, the U.S. Congress, other Federal agencies, State and local governments, business, and labor representatives. It also serves as a statistical resource to the Department of Labor.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.
